section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Billing agent" means a person that submits charges for products or services to a telephone company or reseller on behalf of the person submitting the charges or on behalf of a third-party vendor.
"Customer" means a customer of a telephone company or reseller.

"Express authorization" means an express, affirmative act by an ordering customer in the form of:
A written authorization;
An oral authorization verified and recorded by an independent party; or
A recorded electronic authorization.
"Ordering customer" means a customer or another person ordering services that will appear on the customer's telephone bill.
"Reseller" means a person that provides wireline telephone voice service by using the transmission facilities of another person.
"Telephone company" means a person that provides wireline telephone voice services.

"Third-party vendor" means an entity not affiliated with a telephone company or reseller that:
Provides products or services to a customer; and
Seeks to charge the customer through third-party vendor billing.

"Third-party vendor billing" means the use of a telephone company's or reseller's billing system, either directly or through a billing agent, to charge a customer for products or services provided by a third-party vendor.
"Third-party vendor billing" does not include billing for:

text.section: Unless the third-party vendor or billing agent first obtains an ordering customer's express authorization, a third-party vendor or billing agent may not submit charges to a telephone company or reseller.

The express authorization required under subsection (b) of this section shall:
Be separate from any solicitation material or entry forms for sweepstakes or contests; and
Include:
The name and telephone number of the ordering customer;
The date of authorization;
An explanation of:
An affirmation by the ordering customer that:
A third-party vendor or billing agent shall retain a copy of the express authorization required under subsection (b) of this section for 2 years after the date of authorization.

A customer is not liable for third-party vendor billing charges unless:
The customer has been given notice that the telephone company or reseller may allow third-party vendor billing and that free blocking of certain third-party vendor billing may be available to the customer; and
The customer is provided access to:
An itemization of the third-party vendor billing charges identifying them separately from other charges; and
The name and telephone number of the third-party vendor or its billing agent.

Unless the third-party vendor or billing agent provides a copy of the authorization required under subsection (b) of this section to the customer and to the telephone company or reseller, a customer is not liable for third-party vendor billing charges if the customer, in good faith and in a reasonably timely manner, but not outside the time period specified in subsection (d) of this section, disputes that the charges were authorized.

An agreement for third-party vendor billing entered into by a telephone company or reseller and a third-party vendor or billing agent on or after October 1, 2010, is void and unenforceable to the extent that it does not require the third-party vendor to comply with subsection (b) of this section.

A violation of this section by a third-party vendor or billing agent:
Is an unfair or deceptive trade practice under Title 13 of this article; and
Except for the provisions of § 13-411 of this article, is subject to the enforcement and penalty provisions contained in Title 13 of this article.
